OLD DOMINION FOUNDATION
716 JACKSON PLACE, N-W.
WASHINGTON 6, D.C.
April 7j 1954
Dr* Graydon Ausmus, President,
National Association of
Educ ational Broadc as ters,
University of Alabama,
Tuscaloosa, Alabama.
Dear Dr* Ausmus:
The Old Dominion Foundation has recently arranged
with Dr. W. Y* Elliott, of Harvard, to undertake a
survey of educational problems and opportunities in
Virginia, with particular attention to the present situa¬
tion in educational radio and television.
In talking yesterday with Mr. Robert Mullen,
Director of the National Citizens Committee for Educa¬
tional Television, it became apparent that information
relative to the scope of your Association’s work would
be most helpful to us.
While we would appreciate general information in
regard to your use of tape recordings for educational
broadcasts, one specific question which comes to mind
at this early stage of Dr. Elliott's study is whether
or not the Association permits the use of its tapes on
commercial stations. If so, must it be sustaining rather
than commercial time?
I am sure that we will want to bother you with
questions from time to time in the future, but whatever
you can send us here at the outset would, I am sure, be
of help as we try to get our bearings.
Assistant to the President
